ranked_diseases.explanation: All three reference cases with chronic oral candidiasis were diagnosed with this condition. This primary immunodeficiency specifically predisposes to fungal infections including chronic mucocutaneous candidiasis.
Classic presentation with chronic oral candidiasis as a primary feature. This autosomal dominant disorder specifically affects mucosal immunity against Candida species.
Associated with IL17RC deficiency, presents with chronic mucocutaneous candidiasis. The isolated oral candidiasis in this patient could represent an early or mild phenotype.
Caused by IL17RA deficiency, presents with chronic mucocutaneous candidiasis. Similar to other IL-17 pathway defects but with variable severity.
CARD9 deficiency causes susceptibility to fungal infections including chronic oral candidiasis. Often presents with more severe systemic fungal infections.

ranked_diseases.disease_name: Immunodeficiency 73C with defective neutrophil chemotaxis and hypogammaglobulinemia
ranked_diseases.explanation: Can present with recurrent fungal infections including oral candidiasis due to neutrophil dysfunction and antibody deficiency.
Gain-of-function mutations in STAT1 cause chronic mucocutaneous candidiasis along with other infections. Often has broader infectious susceptibility.
Associated with STAT1 deficiency, presents with chronic mucocutaneous candidiasis as a prominent feature along with mycobacterial susceptibility.
